text: Hi, I have a 3 dimensional Vector{Vector{Vector{Int8}}} and I want to get a martrix by summing across first dimension

elements.text: Hi, I have a 3 dimensional Vector{Vector{Vector{Int8}}} and I want to get a martrix by summing across first dimension

text: You probably want to work with an `Array{Int8, 3}` instead of nested vectors. Then you can just use `sum(x, dims=1)`

text:
Same, I would recommend trying to work with `Array{Int8, 3}` if you're able directly make that type of variable. Feel free to try to ask on Slack for any advice on that

My experience with Julia so far is that its cumbersome if I'm trying to work with vector of vectors or arrays of arrays. Usually, I have a much easier time working with an Array instead.
